Jason Gauci and I are pleased to share with you new results with
HyperNEAT =
 in our new paper to appear in the Twenty-Third AAAI
Conference on Artifici=
al Intelligence (2008), "A Case Study on the
Critical Role of Geometric Reg=
ularity in Machine Learning."  The paper
is available here:

http://eplex.c=
s.ucf.edu/index.php?option=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D14&Itemid=3D28#ga=
uci.aaai08

Or for a direct link:

http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/papers/gauci_aaa=
i08.pdf

This paper demonstrates HyperNEAT in a more interesting domain
(ch=
eckers) than our introductory papers from last year and introduces
an effec=
tive method to evolve substrates with a hidden layer.

Jason is also planni=
ng to release the source code for this domain,
although we do not have an e=
xact release date at this time.

Those familiar with AI conferences will al=
so notice that in fact this
paper appears in AAAI, which is more associated=
 with mainstream AI. 
That they accepted a paper in this area is a hopeful =
sign that
evolutionary computation and even indirect encoding can in fact
s=
ucceed in the larger AI community.  We are grateful to the reviewers
and ch=
airs at AAAI for keeping an open mind.

Additional HyperNEAT publications w=
ill be made available soon as well.

ken
